stories.text: I read your post from 2018 where you used Himalayan sea salt cleanses and it made a remarkable difference in your condition.  My 35 year old son is suffering from sibo and has been through multiple rounds of antibiotics, herbals, elemental diets, etc.  He has just had the 3rd day of salt cleanse and we are cautiously optimistic that his gas/bloat is way down.  Can you tell us more about how you are feeling?  Whether you really found a cure for yourself?  Do you still do the salt cleanses?  I would very much appreciate your response.  I have been watching him suffer so badly with trapped bloat and his whole system is affected...brain fog, etc.  This guy was a stand up comedian and bartender before Covid.
stories.title: Salt Water Cleanse for Sibo

stories.text:
I understand the meaning and significance of testing the key assumptions,

In order for the idea to be viable, the key assumptions must hold true. These key assumptions need to be validated in initial user research (in my own words).

But I am somewhat at a loss in listing out what the key assumptions actually are. For me it is just the solution to a problem that annoys me.

Any tips or links to useful resources will be much appreciated.
stories.title: How do I determine the “key assumptions” of a startup
